intro: Baccharis tricuneata, commonly known as the Chilean grevillea, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is typically found in dry, temperate regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in gardens, though it can be invasive in some areas. The species is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
